alert.note: Alert for Peoria (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 10:15AM CST until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and west central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Marshall, Peoria and Stark. In west central Illinois, Knox. * WHEN...Until 115 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1013 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will contribute to flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abingdon, Knoxville, Henry, Princeville, Wyoming, Toulon, Osceola, Bradford, Williamsfield, London Mills, Elmira, Victoria, West Jersey, Maquon, La Fayette, Elmore, Laura, Castleton, Gilson and Camp Grove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
